books.title: WHERE THE CRAWDADS SING
books.author: Delia Owens
books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

books.title: IT ENDS WITH US
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse.

books.title: VERITY
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.publisher: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.
books.description: Lowen Ashleigh is hired by the husband of an injured writer to complete her popular series and uncovers a horrifying truth.

books.title: THE HOTEL NANTUCKET
books.author: Elin Hilderbrand
books.description: The new general manager of a hotel far from its Gilded Age heyday deals with the complicated pasts of her guests and staff.

books.title: UGLY LOVE
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: Tate Collins and Miles Archer, an airline pilot, think they can handle a no strings attached arrangement. But they can't.

books.title: THE SEVEN HUSBANDS OF EVELYN HUGO
books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.description: A movie icon recounts stories of her loves and career to a struggling magazine writer.

books.title: SPARRING PARTNERS
books.author: John Grisham
books.description: Three novellas: “Homecoming,” “Strawberry Moon” and “Sparring Partners.”

books.title: BOOK LOVERS
books.author: Emily Henry
books.description: While on vacation in North Carolina, a literary agent keeps running into an editor.

books.title: ESCAPE
books.author: James Patterson and David Ellis
books.description: The third book in the Billy Harney thriller series. Detective Harney goes after a billionaire crime boss and a prison escape artist.

books.title: THE HOUSE ACROSS THE LAKE
books.author: Riley Sager
books.description: An actress escaping bad press goes to a Vermont lake house and uncovers secrets within a neighboring couple’s marriage.

books.title: NOVEMBER 9
books.author: Colleen Hoover
books.description: Is Ben using his relationship with Fallon as fodder for his novel?

books.title: PEOPLE WE MEET ON VACATION
books.author: Emily Henry
books.description: Opposites Poppy and Alex meet to vacation together one more time in hopes of saving their relationship.

books.title: EVERY SUMMER AFTER
books.author: Carley Fortune
books.description: The love story of Percy and Sam is told over the course of six summers and one weekend.

books.title: BEACH READ
books.author: Emily Henry
books.description: A relationship develops between a literary fiction author and a romance novelist as they both try to overcome writer’s block.

books.title: MALIBU RISING
books.author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
books.description: An epic party has serious outcomes for four famous siblings.

books.title: BATTLE FOR THE AMERICAN MIND
books.author: Pete Hegseth with David Goodwin
books.description: The "Fox & Friends Weekend" host makes his case for what he calls classical Christian education.

books.title: AN IMMENSE WORLD
books.author: Ed Yong
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize–winning science writer explains the sensory perceptions and ways of communication used by a variety of animals.

books.title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
books.author: Bessel van der Kolk
books.description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

books.title: HAPPY-GO-LUCKY
books.author: David Sedaris
books.description: The humorist portrays personal and public upheavals of his life in its seventh decade and the world in the time of a pandemic.

books.title: KILLING THE KILLERS
books.author: Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The 11th book in the conservative commentator’s Killing series gives an account of the global war against terrorists.

books.title: JAMES PATTERSON
books.author: James Patterson
books.description: The author’s life, from growing up in small-town New York to working in the advertising industry to becoming a successful storyteller.

books.title: FINDING ME
books.author: Viola Davis
books.description: The multiple award-winning actress describes the difficulties she encountered before claiming her sense of self and achieving professional success.

books.title: I'D LIKE TO PLAY ALONE, PLEASE
books.author: Tom Segura
books.description: The stand-up comedian and podcaster shares stories of parenting and strange encounters.

books.title: RIVER OF THE GODS
books.author: Candice Millard
books.description: The story of the hardships encountered during 19th-century expeditions in Africa, and the complicated partnerships behind them.

books.title: CRYING IN H MART
books.author: Michelle Zauner
books.description: The daughter of a Korean mother and Jewish-American father, and leader of the indie rock project Japanese Breakfast, describes creating her own identity after losing her mother to cancer.

books.title: THE END OF THE WORLD IS JUST THE BEGINNING
books.author: Peter Zeihan
books.description: A look at potential changes in globalization.

books.title: ROUGH DRAFT
books.author: Katy Tur
books.description: The MSNBC anchor describes growing up with her helicopter journalist parents and her own journey in covering the news.

books.title: BRAIDING SWEETGRASS
books.author: Robin Wall Kimmerer
books.description: A botanist and member of the Citizen Potawatomi Nation espouses having an understanding and appreciation of plants and animals.

books.title: EDUCATED
books.author: Tara Westover
books.description: The daughter of survivalists, who is kept out of school, educates herself enough to leave home for university.

books.title: GREENLIGHTS
books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.

books.title: PAPER TOWNS
books.author: John Green
books.description: After a night of mischief, the girl Quentin loves disappears.

books.title: LOOKING FOR ALASKA
books.author: John Green
books.description: A boy finds excitement when he meets a girl named Alaska.

books.title: ME AND EARL AND THE DYING GIRL
books.author: Jesse Andrews
books.description: A high school senior befriends a girl with cancer.

books.title: THE BOOK THIEF
books.author: Markus Zusak
books.description: A girl copes with life under the Nazis by stealing books.

books.title: MISS PEREGRINE'S HOME FOR PECULIAR CHILDREN
books.author: Ransom Riggs and Cassandra Jean
books.description: An island, an abandoned orphanage and a collection of curious photographs.

books.title: THE FAULT IN OUR STARS
books.author: John Green
books.description: A girl faces new realities when she learns she has cancer.

books.title: THE ABSOLUTELY TRUE DIARY OF A PART-TIME INDIAN
books.author: Sherman Alexie.
books.description: A boy leaves his reservation to attend an all-white school.

books.title: AN ABUNDANCE OF KATHERINES
books.author: John Green
books.description: Colin Singleton wants to break the pattern of being dumped.

books.title: ELEANOR AND PARK
books.author: Rainbow Rowell
books.description: The world opposes the love of two outcast teenagers.

books.title: THIRTEEN REASONS WHY
books.author: Jay Asher
books.description: Before she commits suicide, a girl sends recordings to 13 people.

books.title: THE 5TH WAVE
books.author: Rick Yancey
books.description: Aliens land on earth and the apocalypse begins.

books.title: HOLLOW CITY
books.author: Ransom Riggs
books.description: In 1940 London, Jacob Portman and his friends try to find a cure for their headmistress.

books.title: WILL GRAYSON, WILL GRAYSON
books.author: John Green and David Levithan
books.description: Two boys with the same name join forces in a reality possible only in musical theater.

books.title: IF I STAY
books.author: Gayle Forman
books.description: A young cellist falls into a coma.

books.title: RED QUEEN
books.author: Victoria Aveyard
books.description: A girl with a special power lives in a kingdom divided between an underclass with red blood and an elite with silver.

books.title: ON PURPOSE
books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The third book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. Fame, fortune and creativity pull the members of the comic club in different directions.

books.title: HEARTSTOPPER, VOL. 1
books.author: Alice Oseman
books.description: Charlie and Nick deal with the ups and downs of high school at the same time they grow closer together.

books.title: HEARTSTOPPER VOL. 2
books.description: The second book in the Heartstopper series. Nick discovers things about the people around him, and about himself.

books.title: SPY X FAMILY, VOL. 1
books.author: Tatsuya Endo
books.description: A master spy must pass himself off as a family man to infiltrate a private school, but his new wife is an assassin and adopted child is a telepath.

books.title: HEARTSTOPPER, VOL. 4
books.author: Alice Oseman
books.description: The fourth book in the Heartstopper series. As the school year starts, Charlie and Nick face challenges of revealing who they are and what they feel.

books.title: HEARTSTOPPER VOL. 3
books.author: Alice Oseman
books.description: The third book in the Heartstopper series. Charlie and Nick learn about the coming-out process as they officially become boyfriends.

books.title: PERSPECTIVES
books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The second book in the Cat Kid Comic Club series. Can this cast of characters understand and appreciate one another’s point of view?

books.title: THE BAD GUYS
books.author: Aaron Blabey
books.description: Tough animals in suits take on some real villains; the basis of the movie.

books.title: MOTHERING HEIGHTS
books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The 10th book in the Dog Man series. Can the power of love overcome the darkness and despair created by new villains?

books.title: CAT KID COMIC CLUB
books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: Stories within a story come to life as Li'l Petey, Flippy and Molly show baby frogs how to create comics.

books.title: REMARKABLY RUBY
books.author: Terri Libenson
books.description: The sixth book in the Emmie & Friends series. Ruby writes poetry while Mia runs for class president. Will they become friends again?

books.title: DEATH NOTE SHORT STORIES
books.author: Tsugumi Ohba.
books.description: A collection of stories including “C-Kira,” “a-Kira” and more.

books.title: THE BRIGHTEST NIGHT
books.author: Tui T. Sutherland.
books.description: The fifth book in the Wings of Fire series. Sunny must decide if her destiny is already set.

books.title: GRIME AND PUNISHMENT
books.author: Dav Pilkey
books.description: The ninth book in the Dog Man series. After turning in his badge, the canine cop is determined not to just roll over.

books.title: SOLO LEVELING, VOL. 4
books.author: Chugong.
books.description: Jinwoo and the White Tiger trainees become stranded in a frozen forest.

books.title: THINKING, FAST AND SLOW
books.author: Daniel Kahneman
books.description: A winner of the Nobel in economic science discusses how we make choices in business and personal lives and when we can and cannot trust our intuitions.

books.title: GRIT
books.author: Angela Duckworth
books.description: A psychologist says passion and perseverance are the keys to success.

books.title: THING EXPLAINER
books.author: Randall Munroe
books.description: Cells, elevators, smartphones, nuclear reactors and more are demystified with simply annotated blueprints. From the author of "What If?"

books.title: SPEAKING AMERICAN
books.author: Josh Katz
books.description: The creator of the New York Times dialect quiz provides a guide to how words are pronounced in different parts of the country.

books.title: I AM MALALA
books.author: Malala Yousafzai with Christina Lamb
books.description: The experience of the young Pakistani advocate for women’s education who was shot by the Taliban and later won the Nobel Peace Prize. Originally published in 2013.

books.title: ON WRITING
books.author: Stephen King
books.description: A memoir that is a master class on the writer's craft.

books.title: WEAPONS OF MATH DESTRUCTION
books.author: Cathy O'Neil
books.description: How decisions that impact our lives are made by algorithms instead of people.

books.title: BEST AMERICAN NONREQUIRED READING 2016
books.author: edited  Rachel Kushner
books.description: A wide-ranging anthology selected by high school students.

books.title: HOW NOT TO BE WRONG
books.author: Jordan Ellenberg
books.description: A mathematician shows how his discipline helps us think about problems of politics, medicine and commerce.

books.title: OTHER-WORDLY
books.author: Yee-Lum Mak
books.description: From the blog of the same name, 64 intriguing words from a dozen languages.

books.title: PRINCIPLES FOR DEALING WITH THE CHANGING WORLD ORDER
books.author: Ray Dalio

books.title: TALKING AS FAST AS I CAN
books.author: Lauren Graham
books.description: Essays by the star of “Gilmore Girls” (both the original and the mini-series) and “Parenthood.”

books.title: BORN A CRIME
books.author: Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the comedian, now the host of “The Daily Show,” who was born into an illegal interracial relationship.

books.title: THE DAILY SHOW (THE BOOK)
books.author: Chris Smith
books.description: An oral history of the show, based on extensive interviews with Jon Stewart and others.

books.title: THE GIRL WITH THE LOWER BACK TATTOO
books.author: Amy Schumer
books.description: Humorous personal essays by the comedian, actor and writer.

books.title: SCRAPPY LITTLE NOBODY
books.author: Anna Kendrick
books.description: Autobiographical essays by the young actress.

books.title: SUPERFICIAL
books.author: Andy Cohen
books.description: The further adventures of the TV producer ("Watch What Happens: Live" and the "Real Housewives" franchise) and personality.

books.title: WISHFUL DRINKING
books.author: Carrie Fisher
books.description: A memoir based on Fisher’s one-woman autobiographical show. Originally published in 2008.

books.title: GO THE -- TO SLEEP
books.author: Adam Mansbach
books.description: A children's book parody for tired parents. Originally published in 2011.

books.title: WHY NOT ME?
books.author: Mindy Kaling
books.description: More personal essays from the comedian and actress, the creator of "The Mindy Project."

books.title: KATHY GRIFFIN'S CELEBRITY RUN-INS
books.author: Kathy Griffin
books.description: From Woody Allen to Warren Zevon, an alphabetical list (with anecdotes) of the celebrities Griffin has met during her years in show business.

books.title: THE IMMORTAL LIFE OF HENRIETTA LACKS
books.author: Rebecca Skloot
